title: Dr Hilary's phone blunder distracts viewers - and he blames 'Boris Johnson'
text:

Dr Hilary was left red-faced today when his mobile phone went off live on air.

Lorraine’s Change + Check campaign had reached its final stop today and the doctor was standing outside 10 Downing Street with producer Helen Addis.

His phone started ringing while Helen, who was diagnosed with breast cancer in April 2018, spoke about her personal reason to start the campaign.

Interrupting the interview, Lorraine Kelly cried: "Hilary Jones is that your phone going?"

The embarrassed doctor tried to subtly take his phone out of his jacket pocket and switch it off.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Helen joked: "I think it's Boris telling us to get a move on."

In agreement, Lorraine said: "I really hope that is Boris Johnson asking you in for a cup of tea."

The giggling doctor added: "Absolutely, he’s asking us to come in now."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Lorraine viewers took to Twitter after watching Hilary's awkward blunder.

One viewer said: "That inspirational lady was trying to deliver a very important message! And you waffling on about the doctors phone! Come On!"

Another added: "His phone going off FFS"

A third said: "Being interviewed on live tv and mobile phone goes off"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Producer Helen Addis, who launched the campaign to encourage women to check for the signs and symptoms of breast cancer, knocked on the door of Number 10 to personally deliver the campaign’s how-to stickers.

Helen said: “I’ve got goosebumps! What a way to end a really, really successful Change + Check ‘Boob Bus’ tour and to be here at Downing Street.”

She added: “Breast cancer, it’s a horrific disease.”

*Lorraine airs weekdays on ITV at 8.30am
description: Lorraine Kelly was forced to interrupt to ask Dr Hilary Jones to sort out his mobile while he was stood outside 10 Downing Street
